attributes.action: Allow Victoria Cross Winner, Tul Bahadur Pun VC, to live in the UK .
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
A GURKHA soldier, awarded the Victoria Cross whilst fighting for Britain has been banned from coming to live here - because he has "failed to demonstrate strong ties with the UK".

Tul Bahadur Pun, 84, who won Britain's highest bravery medal in the Second World War, wants to spend his last days among old comrades and having treatment for several health problems.

Government officials have rejected his request toreside here and qualified the decision by saying "This is because you have failed to demonstrate that you have strong ties with the UK." 

Surely, having fought for this country AND being awarded our highest honour for bravery, are strong enough ties?

Please add your support to allow this honourable gentleman to live his life out , in the UK, with dignity.
